name: Good Afternoon Charlie
description:
By: Jack Wasielewski

OAT MIIIILK, OAT MIIIIILK, OAT MIIIIIIIILK!

THE OMNISCIENT:  This is an undergraduate architecture thesis?  I guess we'll call it that.  That's the pretext under which it was developed, and that's why you'll find some process images and drawings and things and it's not just straight game.  ESCAPE THE HELLSCAPE TO THE ABOVE-WORLD DON'T LET THEM OVERTAKE YOU AAAAHHHHH.

THE OMNISCIENT:  There are more versions coming, this can be referred to as the alpha.  There are collisions and things that don't line up, perhaps some bugs.  First game I've ever made; give me a break please.  Also, a few models and most audio I did not make originally, just edited.  All power goes to their creators; a full credits screen (and for that matter, a title screen too) is coming soon.

THE OMNISCIENT:  So, this is important.  The controls if you're using gamepad are listed in the game experience (I know, I know).  If you're using mouse and keyboard, the controls are as follows: WASD - Move; Space - Jump; Left Shift - Sprint; C - Crouch; Mouse - Look; Left Click - Throw; Right Click - Zoom; F - Pick Up; E - Interact; R - Reset.

THE OMNISCIENT:  If you're interested, in the folder is a script/research paper of sorts that propelled the game's development.  Also also, a link to the game trailer can be found here, and a link to a full gameplay walkthrough can be found here.

THE OMNISCIENT:  I hope you enjoy,  and any questions or suggestions can be directed to my email at jackrw99@vt.edu or they can listed in the comments (preferable).
